poem:
Title: A Brother's Shadow in Unjust Chains

A distant cell frames a Swedish son,
In Iran's grasp, 663 days undone.
Verdict lingers, a ghastly ghost,
On familial hearts, it weighs the most.
"Can this be real?" his sister cries,
receiving death in bitter sighs.
A bleeding tie, a frightful fear,
Brother's life lost, dreadfully near.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Family of Swede imprisoned in Iran fear death penalty verdict is imminent The family of a Swedish EU diplomat imprisoned in Iran for more than 663 days fear he will be given a death sentence or life imprisonment within the coming days after prosecutors sought the maximum sentence in his case. “I ask how can this be happening? He is my brother and I’m like: they want to kill my younger brother? That is very". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
